dmca.title: [ABUSE] Copyright violation]
dmca.body:
nc

Note the site: "arrrgh." 

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, April 29, 2005 8:06 PM
To: Copyright Compliance
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright violation]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

For your review.
- --
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html


- -------- Original Message --------
From: - Fri Apr 29 20:00:32 2005
X-Mozilla-Status: 0001
X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000

mail

1DRK5a-0006YS-MF        for abuseadm@theplanet.com; Thu, 28 Apr 2005
20:14:42 -0500

helo=[216.185.111.52])        by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from
abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com)        with esmtp (Exim)        id
1DRK5Z-000BAJ-Q2; Thu, 28 Apr 2005 20:14:42 -0500

1DRK5X-0006Xp-SA; Thu, 28 Apr 2005 20:14:39 -0500

webshield2.york.cuny.edu via        csmap id
7f726bcc_b84c_11d9_8ed4_0002b3eef60f_20437;        Thu, 28 Apr 2005 21:17:48
- -0400 (EDT)

(8.12.11/8.12.10) with ESMTP id j3T1PHUf024357;        Thu, 28 Apr 2005
21:25:17 -0400 (EDT)
Received: from 172.16.29.175 ([172.16.29.175])         by mail.york.cuny.edu
(IMP) with HTTP         for <drobnicki@localhost>; Thu, 28 Apr 2005 21:25:17
-0400
Message-ID: <1114737917.42718cfd41f76@mail.york.cuny.edu>
Date: Thu, 28 Apr 2005 21:25:17 -0400
From: John Drobnicki <drobnicki@york.cuny.edu>
To: abuse@theplanet.com, admins@theplanet.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
User-Agent: Internet Messaging Program (IMP) 3.2.2
X-Originating-IP: 172.16.29.175
X-NAIMIME-Disclaimer: 1
X-NAIMIME-Modified: 1
Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 198.61.16.8 is neither
permitted nor denied by domain of york.cuny.edu) client-ip=198.61.16.8;
envelope-from=drobnicki@york.cuny.edu;
helo=webshield2.york.cuny.edu;
X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
X-Spam-Score: -99.8
Cc: germar_rudolf@usa.net
Subject: [ABUSE] Copyright violation
X-BeenThere: abuse@lists.theplanet.com
X-Mailman-Version: 2.1.5
Precedence: list
List-Id: abuse.lists.theplanet.com
List-Unsubscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Post: <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
List-Help: <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
List-Subscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
Sender: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
Errors-To: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
X-Spam-Score: -99.8

To Whom It May Concern:

It has come to my attention that there is a document on one of your
company's websites that reproduces the full-text of one of my articles,
which is a violation of the article's copyright.  The document is located
at:

http://www.vho.org/aaargh/fran/actu/actu02/doc2002/BibHolDenial.pdf

According to the ARIN service, theplanet.com is the ISP for the domain
vho.org.

Although the title of my article is uncredited in the above mentioned
document, pages 70-115 of this PDF document contain the full-text of my
copyrighted article, "Holocaust-Denial Literature: An Additional
Bibliography", which was published in the Dec. 1996 Bulletin of
Bibliography.
You can easily compare pp. 70-115 of the vho.org document with my article,
which is located at:

http://www.york.cuny.edu/~drobnick/holbib2.html

You might be interested to know that the first half of this PDF document
(pp.
1-70) contains material taken from a document prepared by Mark Aaron Polger,
who is currently a librarian at the University of Waterloo Library in
Ontario, Canada.

By hosting this page, you are infringing upon my copyright.  Thus, I am
instructing you to remove and destroy the file from your servers within 5
days.  Because it is a violation of copyright, both FastDNS.net and
Internetconnection.net required this same group (AAARGH) to remove this same
document from their other servers (aaargh-international.org, and
abbc.com) in
2003.  This is the 6th time that my copyrighted material has been used
online by AAARGH or one of their affiliates without my consent.

Please note that I am not concerned with the rest of the VHO site and am in
no way trying to censor VHO's expression; I only want my own copyrighted
materials to be removed permanently.  VHO and AAARGH may feel free to
replace the file with a link to the authorized version:

http://www.york.cuny.edu/~drobnick/holbib2.html

I am asking that theplanet.com take swift action against this copyright
violation.

I thank you in advance for your cooperation.

John Drobnicki
Professor & Head of Reference Services
York College/CUNY
http://www.york.cuny.edu/~drobnick/




Scanned for Malware by York College/CUNY

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
